db:abstract.db:para: The example shows how to create a simple area chart.

db:section.db:title: Running the Example
db:section.db:para: To run the example from Qt Creator, open the Welcome mode and select the example from Examples. For more information, visit Building and Running an Example.

db:section.db:title: Creating Area Charts
db:section.db:para: To create area charts, we need two QLineSeries instances. They are going to define the upper and lower boundary of the area.
db:section.db:programlisting: QLineSeries *series0 = new QLineSeries(); QLineSeries *series1 = new QLineSeries();
db:section.db:para: We add data to both series and use the stream operator.
Now we create a QAreaSeries instance using two line series objects. We set the custom gradient fill and width of the outline.
Last we create the QChartView instance, set the title, set anti-aliasing, and add the area series. We also create the default axes and specify the ranges on them.
The chart is ready to be shown.
